snippet: Taking another step to restrict Russia’s Internet, President Vladimir V. Putin quietly signed a new law requiring popular online voices to register with the government.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin quietly signs new law requiring popular online voices to register with the government, another major step toward restricting the Internet; lawyers, Internet pioneers and political activists say measure will give the government a much wider ability to track who said what online.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Roth and Alexandra Odynova from Moscow; Tim Arango from Baghdad; Declan Walsh from London; Marjorie Connelly, Noam Cohen and Peter Lattmann from New York; and Vindu Goel from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Taking another step to restrict Russia’s Internet, President Vladimir V. Putin quietly signed a new law requiring popular online voices to register with the government.

headline.main: Russia Quietly Tightens Reins on Web With ‘Bloggers Law’
headline.print_headline: Russia Quietly Tightens Reins on Web With ‘Bloggers Law’
